ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How certain are you that you will NOT attempt suicide in the future?
If at some point in the future you had suicidal thoughts, how certain are you that you could resist making a suicide attempt?
If at some point in the future you had suicidal thoughts, how certain are you that you could resist making a suicide attempt if you were using alcohol or other drugs?
How certain are you that you could control future thoughts of suicide if you were experiencing physical pain?
How certain are you that you could control future suicidal thoughts if you lost an important relationship?
How certain are you that you could control future suicidal thoughts if you lost a job, could not find employment, or suffered a financial crisis?
Total number of suicide attempts documented in medical record since the date of study enrollment
SEASA Total
How confident are you that you will not attempt suicide in the future?
If you have thoughts of killing yourself in the future, how confident are you that you will be able to keep yourself from attempting suicide?
If you have thoughts of killing yourself in the future, how confident are you that you will tell someone?
Respondent
Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections

ElementDescription: How hopeful and optimistic are you about the future?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Somewhat; 4= Quite a bit; 5= Very much

ElementDescription: How much do people in your family understand you?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= Just a little; 3= Somewhat; 4= Quite a bit; 5= Very much

ElementDescription: How much does your family pay attention to you?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= Just a little; 3= Somewhat; 4= Quite a bit; 5= Very much
